Subparagraph.Text: in the case of fuel that is sold for export by the producer or the importer before its exportation, the province in which the batch was located when ownership of the batch was transferred by that sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in any other case, the province via which the exportation is to occur; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if known, whether the batch of renewable fuel is to be blended with liquid petroleum fuel at a facility in Canada and, if so, the name of the person, or persons, who is to own the resulting blended fuel and the civic address of the facility.

Subsection.Text: For each gasoline compliance period during which the producer or importer produces or imports renewable fuel, they must, on or before February 15 following the end of the compliance period, send a report to the Minister that contains the information set out in Schedule 7 for the gasoline compliance period.

Heading.TitleText: Persons Who Are Required To Register

Subsection.Text: A person who sends a registration report must send to the Minister a report on measurement methods, signed by an authorized official, that contains the information set out in Schedule 8 on or before the later of the day that is 180 days after the day on which this section comes into force and the day on which they send the registration report. The report on measurement methods must provide that information for each facility, and for each province via which importation occurs, that is, or is to be, identified in the registration report.

If the information provided in the report on measurement methods — other than the information referred to in paragraph 1(b) or (c) of Schedule 8 — changes, the person must send a notice to the Minister that provides the updated information no later than five days after the change.

Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a production facility that is decommissioned, and ceases producing gasoline, diesel fuel and heating distillate oil, before the day that is 180 days after this section comes into force.

A person other than a participant, or a producer or importer of renewable fuel, who, during a gasoline compliance period, sells for export a batch of renewable fuel, or of liquid petroleum fuel that has renewable fuel content, must record

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the type of fuel, from the following fuel types, that was so sold:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: renewable fuel, in which case, the type of renewable fuel must be specified and, if known, each type of renewable fuel feedstock that was used to produce that renewable fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: finished gasoline,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: unfinished gasoline,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: diesel fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: heating distillate oil, or

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: another type of liquid petroleum fuel, in which case, the type must be specified; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, of the batch of renewable fuel or of the renewable fuel content in the batch of liquid petroleum fuel, as the case may be; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the province in which the batch was located when ownership of the batch was transferred.

Subsection.Text: For each gasoline compliance period during which the person sold for export a batch referred to in subsection (1), they must, on or before February 15 following the end of the compliance period, send a report to the Minister that contains the following information for the compliance period, for each type of renewable fuel by each province in which the fuel was located when ownership of the fuel was transferred by that sale:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, of renewable fuel sold for export and, if known, that volume, by each type of renewable fuel feedstock; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, of renewable fuel content in each type of liquid petroleum fuel sold for export.

Subsection.Text: Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply to a person who, during a gasoline compliance period, sells for export less than 1000 m3 of renewable fuel or of liquid petroleum fuel that has renewable fuel content.

Section.Text: Except as otherwise provided in these Regulations, records must be made as soon as feasible but no later than 30 days after the information to be recorded becomes available.

Subsection.Text: A person who is required under these Regulations to make a record or send a report or notice must keep the record or a copy of the report or notice, as well as any supporting documents that relate to the information contained in that record or copy, for at least five years after they make the record or send the report or notice. The record or copy must be kept at the person’s principal place of business in Canada or at any other place in Canada where it can be inspected. If the record or copy is kept at one of those other places, the person must provide the Minister with the civic address of that other place.
Every participant must keep supporting documents evidencing the information recorded under section 31 in their compliance unit account book and recorded under sections 29 and 32, including,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: data on and calculations of volumes recorded;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: dated metered-values, bills of lading, invoices, sales receipts, records of payment and records of transactions for gasoline, diesel fuel, heating distillate oil, renewable fuel and biocrude that are used, blended, sold, imported or acquired from or transferred to another fuel supplier or facility; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: dated contracts, records of transfer, invoices, records of payment and agreements for transfers of gasoline, diesel fuel, heating distillate oil, renewable fuel, biocrude and compliance units.

Subsection.Text: A person who would, if the first gasoline compliance period were to end on December 31, 2011, be required to send a report under section 30 or 33 or subsection 34(4) or 36(2) must send an interim report to the Minister for the period that begins on December 15, 2010 and that ends on December 31, 2011 in accordance with that section or subsection but as if that period were the first gasoline compliance period.

A person who would, if the second distillate compliance period were to end on December 31, 2013, be required to send a report under section 30 or 33 must send an interim report to the Minister for the period that begins on January 1, 2013 and that ends on December 31, 2013 in accordance with that section but as if that distillate compliance period ended on December 31, 2013.
Subject to subsections (2) and (3), these Regulations come into force on the day on which they are registered.
Subsection 5(1), sections 6 to 8, sections 12 to 25 and 28 to 33, subsections 34(3) and (4) and sections 36 and 39 come into force on December 15, 2010.
Subsection 5(2) comes into force on July 1, 2011.

ScheduleFormHeading.Label: SCHEDULE 1
ScheduleFormHeading.TitleText: Registration Report — Information Required from a Primary Supplier

Section.Text: Information respecting the primary supplier:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name and civic address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number and, if any, email address and fax number, of their authorized official; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number and, if any, email address and fax number, of a contact person, if different from the authorized official.

Section.Text: For each production facility at which the primary supplier produces gasoline, diesel fuel or heating distillate oil, the civic address and name, if any, of the facility.

For each production facility at which the primary supplier produced, and for each province via which they imported — during the calendar year before the calendar year in which the report or notice, as the case may be, is sent — any of the following fuels, the volume, expressed in litres, so produced or imported of:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: finished gasoline;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: unfinished gasoline;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: diesel fuel; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: heating distillate oil.

Section.Text: For each use, export or transit described in any of paragraphs 6(4)(a) to (j) of these Regulations — during the calendar year before the calendar year in which the report or notice, as the case may be, is sent — the volume, expressed in litres, of each of gasoline, diesel fuel and heating distillate oil, if known,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: produced at each of the primary supplier’s production facilities; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: imported by the primary supplier, for each province via which importation occurred.

Section.Text: The information required under Schedule 2 other than that required under its item 1.

ScheduleFormHeading.Label: SCHEDULE 2
ScheduleFormHeading.TitleText: Registration Report — Information Required from a Participant

Section.Text: Information respecting the participant:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name and civic address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number and, if any, email address and fax number, of their authorized official; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number and, if any, email address and fax number, of a contact person, if different from the authorized official.

Section.Text: For each non-mobile facility in Canada at which renewable fuel is blended with a liquid petroleum fuel and the resulting blended fuel is owned, in whole or in part, by the participant, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the civic address and name, if any, of the facility;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for each type of liquid petroleum fuel with which a renewable fuel was blended — during the calendar year before the calendar year in which the report or notice, as the case may be, is sent — at the facility to result in liquid petroleum fuel other than high-renewable-content fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, if known, of the liquid petroleum fuel with which the renewable fuel was blended,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, if known, of the renewable fuel blended,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of renewable fuel and, if known, each type of renewable fuel feedstock that was used to produce the renewable fuel, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the primary use of the products that resulted from the blending; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for each type of liquid petroleum fuel with which a renewable fuel was blended — during the calendar year before the calendar year in which the report or notice, as the case may be, is sent — at the facility to result in high-renewable-content fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, if known, of the liquid petroleum fuel with which the renewable fuel was blended,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, if known, of the renewable fuel blended,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of renewable fuel and, if known, each type of renewable fuel feedstock that was used to produce the renewable fuel, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the primary use of the products that resulted from the blending.

Section.Text: For each fleet of mobile facilities in each province in which renewable fuel is blended with a liquid petroleum fuel and the resulting blended fuel is owned, in whole or in part, by the participant, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the type and number of mobile facilities;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the province where the blending occurs; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for each type of liquid petroleum fuel with which a renewable fuel was blended in one or more of the fleet’s mobile facilities during the calendar year before the calendar year in which the report or notice, as the case may be, is sent,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, if known, of the liquid petroleum fuel with which the renewable fuel was blended,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, if known, of the renewable fuel blended,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of renewable fuel and, if known, each type of renewable fuel feedstock that was used to produce the renewable fuel, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the primary use of the products that resulted from the blending.

Section.Text: For each facility in Canada at which biocrude is used by the participant as feedstock to produce liquid petroleum fuel, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the civic address and name, if any, of the facility, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for each type of biocrude used by the participant as feedstock at the facility during the calendar year before the calendar year in which the report or notice, as the case may be, is sent,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if known, each type of renewable fuel feedstock that was used to produce the biocrude,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, if known, of biocrude used,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the primary use of the products produced at the facility, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the process in which the biocrude is used as a feedstock.

Section.Text: For each province via which the participant imported — during the calendar year before the calendar year in which the report or notice, as the case may be, is sent — liquid petroleum fuel with renewable fuel content by each type of liquid petroleum fuel imported, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, if known, of the liquid petroleum fuel imported;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, if known, of renewable fuel in the liquid petroleum fuel imported;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the type of renewable fuel and, if known, each type of renewable fuel feedstock that was used to produce that renewable fuel and the country of origin of that renewable fuel; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the primary use of the products imported.

Section.Text: If, during the calendar year before the calendar year in which the report or notice, as the case may be, is sent, the participant sold neat renewable fuel in Canada to a neat renewable fuel consumer for use as fuel in a combustion device, or used neat renewable fuel in Canada as fuel in a combustion device, separately, for each type of neat renewable fuel so sold and for each type of neat renewable fuel so used, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if known, the total volume, expressed in litres, so sold or used and the volume, expressed in litres, by each type of renewable fuel feedstock that was used to produce that neat renewable fuel; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if known, the type of combustion device in which the neat renewable fuel was so used, namely, a diesel engine, a domestic-type burner, a spark-ignition engine, a boiler, a furnace or another type.

Section.Text: The volume, expressed in litres, of renewable fuel and of biocrude, in Canada owned by the participant as of the last day of the month before the month in which the report or notice, as the case may be, is sent.
The civic address, or addresses, at which records, copies of reports or notices, and any supporting documents required under these Regulations are kept.
The name, civic address and telephone number of the participant or of the producer or importer of renewable fuel.
The name, civic address, telephone number and qualifications of the auditor and, if any, the auditor’s fax number and email address.

The procedures followed by the auditor to assess the validity of the information sent under these Regulations and a statement of the auditor’s opinion as to whether, as the case may be, the participant’s, producer’s or importer’s practices and procedures were appropriate to ensure, and demonstrate, compliance with these Regulations.

A statement by the auditor that they have assessed whether the participant, producer or importer, as the case may be, has determined volumes in accordance with the information on measurement methods that the participant, producer or importer sent under section 35 of these Regulations.
For primary suppliers, the auditor’s assessment of whether the primary supplier has determined

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the volume of their gasoline pool and of their distillate pool in accordance with section 6 of these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the volume of renewable fuel in their gasoline pool and in their distillate pool in accordance with section 8 of these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: For participants, a statement by the auditor that the auditor has reviewed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: all the participant’s documentation in respect of their transfers in trade or receipt in trade of compliance units; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the participant’s compliance unit account book.

Subsection.Text: The auditor’s assessment of whether entries in the participant’s compliance unit account book are evidenced by the other records and documents required under these Regulations.

Section.Text: The auditor’s assessment of the extent to which the participant, producer or importer, as the case may be, has complied with these Regulations in respect of the gasoline compliance period or distillate compliance period, as the case may be.

A description by the auditor of the nature and date, if the auditor is able to determine the date, of any inaccuracy in the participant’s, producer’s or importer’s records, as the case may be, and of any other deviation from the requirements of these Regulations by the participant, producer or importer.

ScheduleFormHeading.Label: SCHEDULE 4
ScheduleFormHeading.TitleText: Annual Report — Information Required from a Primary Supplier

Section.Text: Information respecting the primary supplier:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name and civic address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number and, if any, email address and fax number, of their authorized official; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number and, if any, email address and fax number, of a contact person, if different from the authorized official.

Section.Text: The volume, expressed in litres, of their gasoline pool and the value of each of the elements of the equation in subsection 8(1) of these Regulations.
The volume, expressed in litres

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the first gasoline compliance period, of their distillate pool determined using the pre-distillate compliance period as if it were the distillate compliance period; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, of their distillate pool.

Section.Text: The value of each of the elements of the equation in subsection 8(2) of these Regulations.

For each production facility and for each province via which importation occurred, the volume, expressed in litres, other than any volume referred to in paragraphs 6(a) and (b), of the following fuels produced at the facility or imported:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: finished gasoline;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: unfinished gasoline;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: diesel fuel; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: heating distillate oil.

Section.Text: For each fuel described in any of paragraphs6(4)(a) to (j) of these Regulations,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sum of the volumes, expressed in litres, subtracted under subsection 6(4) of these Regulations of each of gasoline, diesel fuel and heating distillate oil

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for each production facility, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for each province via which importation occurred; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the sum of the sums obtained under subparagraphs (a)(i) and (ii).

ScheduleFormHeading.Label: SCHEDULE 5
ScheduleFormHeading.TitleText: Annual Report — Information Required from a Participant

Section.Text: Information respecting the participant:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name and civic address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number and, if any, email address and fax number, of their authorized official; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number and, if any, email address and fax number, of a contact person, if different from the authorized official.

Section.Text: For each non-mobile facility in Canada at which the participant created a compliance unit by blending renewable fuel with a liquid petroleum fuel, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the civic address and name, if any, of the facility;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for each type of liquid petroleum fuel with which a renewable fuel was blended at the facility to result in liquid petroleum fuel other than high-renewable-content fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, of the liquid petroleum fuel with which the renewable fuel was blended,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, of the renewable fuel blended,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of renewable fuel and, if known, each type of renewable fuel feedstock that was used to produce that renewable fuel, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of gasoline compliance units and of distillate compliance units that were created under section 13 of these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for each type of liquid petroleum fuel with which a renewable fuel was blended at the facility to result in high-renewable-content fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, of the liquid petroleum fuel with which the renewable fuel was blended,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, of the renewable fuel blended,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the volumetrically-weighted average of renewable fuel content in the resulting high-renewable-content fuel, expressed as volume per cent,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of renewable fuel and, if known, each type of renewable fuel feedstock that was used to produce that renewable fuel, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of gasoline compliance units and of distillate compliance units that were created under section 13 of these Regulations.

Section.Text: For each province in which the participant created a compliance unit by blending renewable fuel with liquid petroleum fuel in a mobile facility that is part of a fleet, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the type and number of those mobile facilities;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the province where the blending occurred; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for each type of liquid petroleum fuel with which a renewable fuel was blended to result in liquid petroleum fuel other than high-renewable-content fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, of the liquid petroleum fuel with which the renewable fuel was blended,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, of the renewable fuel blended,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of renewable fuel and, if known, each type of renewable fuel feedstock that was used to produce that renewable fuel, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of gasoline compliance units and of distillate compliance units that were created under section 13 of these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for each type of liquid petroleum fuel with which a renewable fuel was blended to result in high-renewable-content fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, of the liquid petroleum fuel with which the renewable fuel was blended,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, of the renewable fuel blended,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the volumetrically-weighted average of renewable fuel content in the resulting high-renewable-content fuel, expressed as volume per cent,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of renewable fuel and, if known, each type of renewable fuel feedstock that was used to produce that renewable fuel, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of gasoline compliance units and of distillate compliance units that were created under section 13 of these Regulations.

Section.Text: For each province in which the participant created a compliance unit by importing liquid petroleum fuel with renewable fuel content, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for each type of liquid petroleum fuel other than high-renewable-content fuel that was imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, of the liquid petroleum fuel imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, of the renewable fuel in the imported liquid petroleum fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of renewable fuel and, if known, each type of renewable fuel feedstock that was used to produce the renewable fuel and the country of origin of that renewable fuel, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of gasoline compliance units and of distillate compliance units that were created under section 14 of these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for each type of high-renewable-content fuel imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, of the liquid petroleum fuel imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, of the renewable fuel in the imported liquid petroleum fuel,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the volumetrically-weighted average of renewable fuel content in the imported high-renewable-content fuel, expressed as volume per cent,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of renewable fuel and, if known, each type of renewable fuel feedstock that was used to produce the renewable fuel and the country of origin of that renewable fuel, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of gasoline compliance units and of distillate compliance units that were created under section 14 of these Regulations.

Section.Text: For each production facility in Canada at which the participant created a compliance unit by using biocrude as feedstock, and for each type of biocrude, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the civic address and name, if any, of the facility;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, of biocrude used as feedstock and, if known, that volume, by each country of origin;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the number of gasoline compliance units and of distillate compliance units created under section 15 of these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the number of gasoline compliance units and of distillate compliance units cancelled under subsection 25(5) of these Regulations.

Section.Text: For each facility in Canada at which the participant created a compliance unit by using neat renewable fuel, and for each province in which the participant created a compliance unit by selling neat renewable fuel to a neat fuel consumer, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the civic address and name, if any, of the facility, or the province, as the case may be;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, of neat renewable fuel sold to each neat renewable fuel consumer, the name of the neat renewable fuel consumer and, if known, each type of combustion device in which the neat renewable fuel was used as fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, of neat renewable fuel used as fuel by the participant and, if known, that volume by each type of combustion device in which the neat renewable fuel was so used; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the number of gasoline compliance units and of distillate compliance units created under section 16 of these Regulations.

Section.Text: For each other participant from whom the participant received in trade compliance units, the name of that other participant and the number of gasoline compliance units and of distillate compliance units so received during the trading period in respect of the compliance period.

For each primary supplier to whom the participant transferred in trade compliance units, the name of that primary supplier and the number of gasoline compliance units and of distillate compliance units so transferred in trade during the trading period in respect of the compliance period.

Subsection.Text: The number of gasoline compliance units and of distillate compliance units, if any, that were, in respect of the compliance period,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: carried forward into the next compliance period;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: carried forward into the compliance period from the preceding compliance period;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: carried back into the compliance period; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: carried back from the compliance period into the preceding compliance period.

Subsection.Text: In addition, for the first distillate compliance period, the number of distillate compliance units carried forward into that period, if any.

Section.Text: The number of gasoline compliance units and of distillate compliance units, if any, cancelled

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: under subsection 25(1) of these Regulations as a result of the primary supplier having carried back compliance units;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: under subsection 25(3) of these Regulations because they were in excess of the maximum permitted;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: under subsection 25(4) of these Regulations because compliance units were neither used nor carried forward;

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: under subsection 25(6) of these Regulations because compliance units were neither carried forward nor assigned as envisaged by that subsection; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: under paragraph 11(3)(c) of these Regulations as a result of the elective participant ending their participation in the trading system.

Section.Text: For each province from which the participant, or one of their affiliates who is not a participant, exported a liquid petroleum fuel with renewable fuel content

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the volume exported, expressed in litres, by type of liquid petroleum fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of exported diesel fuel and heating distillate oil, the volume, expressed in litres, of renewable fuel contained in those fuels, by each type of renewable fuel and by each type of renewable fuel feedstock, if known, that was used to produce that renewable fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of exported liquid petroleum fuel other than diesel fuel and heating distillate oil, the volume, expressed in litres, of renewable fuel contained in that fuel, by each type of renewable fuel and by each type of renewable fuel feedstock, if known, that was used to produce that renewable fuel; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the number of gasoline compliance units and of distillate compliance units cancelled under subsection 25(2) of these Regulations.

Section.Text: If the participant is a primary supplier, for each month during the gasoline compliance period or distillate compliance period, as the case may be,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number of gasoline compliance units in respect of the gasoline compliance period

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: owned by the primary supplier at the end of the month,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: that, during the next month, they transferred in trade that were in excess of those that they received in trade, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: as determined in accordance with subsection 19(1) of these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of distillate compliance units in respect of the distillate compliance period

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: owned by the primary supplier at the end of the month,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: that, during the next month, they transferred in trade that were in excess of those that they received in trade, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: as determined in accordance with subsection 19(2) of these Regulations.

Section.Text: The number of gasoline compliance units and of distillate compliance units owned by the participant at the end of the trading period in respect of the compliance period.
The following information for each province in which the acquisition or transfer took place, by each type of renewable fuel and biocrude:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of any person from whom the participant acquired, in Canada, renewable fuel or biocrude during the compliance period and the volume, expressed in litres, of that fuel or biocrude so acquired from that person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of any person to whom the participant transferred, in Canada, ownership of renewable fuel or biocrude during the compliance period and the volume, expressed in litres, of that fuel or biocrude so transferred to that person; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, of renewable fuel and of biocrude, in Canada, owned by the participant at the end of the compliance period.

Section.Text: If a form and format has been specified by the Minister under subsection 31(5) of these Regulations, a copy of the participant`s compliance unit account book referred to in subsection 31(1) of these Regulations for the trading period in respect of the compliance period.

ScheduleFormHeading.Label: SCHEDULE 6
ScheduleFormHeading.TitleText: Registration Report — Information Required from a Producer or Importer of Renewable Fuel

Section.Text: Information respecting the producer or importer:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name and civic address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number and, if any, email address and fax number, of their authorized official; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number and, if any, email address and fax number, of a contact person, if different from the authorized official.

Section.Text: For each facility in Canada at which the producer produces renewable fuel

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the civic address and name, if any, of each facility;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the type of renewable fuel produced and each type of renewable fuel feedstock that was used to produce the renewable fuel; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, if known, of each type of renewable fuel produced during the calendar year before the calendar year in which the report or notice, as the case may be, is sent.

Section.Text: For each province via which the importer imports renewable fuel,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the type of renewable fuel imported and, if known, each type of renewable fuel feedstock that was used to produce the renewable fuel and the country of origin of that renewable fuel; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the volume, expressed in litres, if known, of each type of renewable fuel imported during the calendar year before the calendar year in which the report or notice, as the case may be, is sent.

Section.Text: The civic address, or addresses, at which records, copies of reports or notices, and any supporting documents required under these Regulations are kept.

ScheduleFormHeading.Label: SCHEDULE 7
ScheduleFormHeading.TitleText: Annual Report — Information Required from a Producer or Importer of Renewable Fuel

Section.Text: Information respecting the producer or importer:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name and civic address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number and, if any, email address and fax number, of their authorized official; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number and, if any, email address and fax number, of a contact person, if different from the authorized official.

Section.Text: For each facility in Canada at which renewable fuel was produced and for each province via which renewable fuel was imported, the volume, expressed in litres, of each type of renewable fuel produced or imported during the gasoline compliance period and, if known, each type of renewable fuel feedstock that was used to produce it and, if imported, the country of origin of that renewable fuel.

For each province in which the producer or importer, during the gasoline compliance period, sold — or produced, or imported, for export — renewable fuel, by type of renewable fuel and by each type of renewable fuel feedstock, the volume, expressed in litres,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sold;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sold for blending at another facility in Canada, if known;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: sold for export; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: produced, or imported, for export.

Section.Text: The name of each person to whom renewable fuel referred to in paragraphs 3(a) to (c) was sold and the volume, expressed in litres, so sold, for each province in which the fuel was located when ownership of the fuel was transferred by that sale.

ScheduleFormHeading.Label: SCHEDULE 8
ScheduleFormHeading.TitleText: Report on Measurement Methods — Information Required

Section.Text: Information respecting the person:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name and civic address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number and, if any, email address and fax number, of their authorized official; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number and, if any, email address and fax number, of a contact person, if different from the authorized official.

Section.Text: For each facility in Canada at which the person is, under these Regulations, to determine a volume of fuel or of biocrude, the civic address, name, if any, and type of the facility.
For each province via which the person is to import a volume of fuel,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the location, within that province, of each point of entry into Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the mode of transportation used for the importation, namely, by cargo tanker, railway car, boat, marine vessel or by another mode of transportation, in which case, that mode; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if, for the purposes of these Regulations, the volume of the batch is to be determined at a facility

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in Canada, its civic address, name, if any, and the type of facility, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in a country other than Canada, the name of that country and the type of facility.

Section.Text: For each facility referred to in item 2 or paragraph 3(c),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of each place within the facility at which the determination of volume is to be made;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the volume is the volume of a batch of fuel, a description of how the batch is identified at that facility;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the volume is to be determined in accordance with paragraph 4(1)(a) of these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the measurement device, if any, including the type and manufacturer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement that the device has been installed and inspected in accordance with the Weights and Measures Act and the regulations made under that Act, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the frequency of calibration for the device, if any, and the name, civic address and telephone number of the person who last calibrated it, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the volume is to be determined in accordance with paragraph 4(1)(b) of these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the measurement standard or method that is to be used, including the title and the organization that publishes it, and if known, the published repeatability and the published precision, and,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number, page or other identifier of the measurement standard or method in the American Petroleum Institute’s Manual of Petroleum Measurement Standards that is to be used;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if the volume is to be determined in accordance with subsection 4(3) of these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a detailed explanation as to why no measurement device, standard or method referred to in subsection 4(1) of these Regulations would allow the person to determine the volume in accordance with that subsection, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a detailed description of the measurement device, standard or method that the independent person is to use to determine the volume and its repeatability and precision;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the temperature to which the volume is to be corrected; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: for biocrude, the methodology for measuring and subtracting the water content of the biocrude.

Section.Text: If the volume was determined in accordance with subsection 4(2) of these Regulations,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the measurement standard or method that was used, including the title and the organization that publishes it, and if known, the published repeatability and the published precision;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number, page or other identifier of the measurement standard or method in the American Petroleum Institute’s Manual of Petroleum Measurement Standards that was deviated from; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the deviation.
